sen.j: 願西尼（がんさいに、生没年不詳）は、平安時代中期の天台宗の尼僧。
sen.e: Gansaini (year of birth and death unknown) was a nun (a Buddhist nun) of Tendai Sect in the mid Heian period.
Gansaini (year of birth and death unknown) was a nun (Buddhist nun) of the Tendai sect in the mid Heian period.
Gansaini (year of birth and death unknown) was a nun (Buddhist nun) of the Tendai sect in the mid Heian period.

sen.j: 父は卜部正親。母は清原氏。源信 (僧侶)・願証尼の姉。
sen.e: Her father was Masachika URABE.
Gansaini's father was Masachika URABE, her mother came from the Kiyohara clan and she was the older sister of her brother Genshin (a monk) and sister Ganshoni.
sen.cmt: Combined this sentence with the next two to reduce fragmentation; added "brother" and "sister" for clarity
sen.e: Gansaini's father was Masachika URABE, her mother came from the Kiyohara clan and she was the older sister of her brother Genshin (a priest) and sister Ganshoni.
sen.cmt: monk を priest に修正しました。

sen.j: 一説によれば妹の願証尼と同一人物とされる。
sen.e: There is a view that she was the same person as her younger sister Ganshoni.
There is another theory that she and her younger sister Ganshoni were the same person.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: There is another theory that she and her younger sister Ganshoni were the same person.

sen.j: 出家後はひたすら法華経を読んで、念仏を唱えた。
sen.e: After she became a nun, she earnestly read Hoke-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra) and prayed to Amida Buddha.
After becoming a nun, she earnestly read the Hoke-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra) and prayed to the Amida Buddha.

sen.j: 戒律を守り、布施されたものは貧しい者たちえ分け与え自らは清貧に甘んじたという。
sen.e: While she adhered to the precepts of Buddhism and distributed offerings she was given among poor people, she herself was reportedly contented with honest poverty.
While she adhered to the precepts of Buddhism and distributed her offerings among poor people, she was reportedly content with living in poverty.

sen.j: 寛弘年間（1004年 - 1012年）になくなったという。
sen.e: She is understood to have died during the Kanko era (1004-1012).
Gansaini allegedly died during the Kanko Era (1004-1012).
sen.cmt: Used given name rather than "She" as it felt more natural due to the content; fixed grammar
sen.e: Gansaini allegedly died during the Kanko era (1004-1012).
sen.cmt: 年間 Era を era に修正しました。

sen.j: その信心ぶりは当時著名であったようである。
sen.e: Her strong faith seemed to be well-known at that time.
